attributes.action: Make the DWP provide email contact details so deaf people can get in touch too.
attributes.background: Access to work are making it extremely difficult to get back into work and off benefits, leaving people without money during training. I want to make a complaint but on their website they only list telephone numbers. This is useless to a deaf person like myself.
attributes.additional_details:
In order to get access to work help for an interpreter during training, ESA must be cancelled. Training is 3 hours a week on minimum wage before the actual job starts, leaving people with no money. More discrimination here because if an interpreter was not required, a person can claim ESA during training as they are not working enough hours per week to come off it. 

I want to make an official complaint via email and receive a quick response but the DWP only provide telephone numbers.

attributes.action: Do not build an extra runway at any London airport. Increase efficiency.
attributes.background: Rather than spending millions on building a new runway we need to better use what airports we have and increase the speed and efficiency of public transport. If we are to meet global CO2 reduction targets this is of paramount importance. Air travel needs not be idolised.
attributes.additional_details: CO2 concentrations are increasing and this is causing global temperatures to rise. Rather than focusing on increased capacity for air travel, encouraging it, we need to better use the airports we have and link them with better (and greener) public transport. This is of paramount importance if we are serious about anthropogenic climate change and considering the Paris agreement. Perhaps we could create jobs in tree-planting, conservation and green energy instead?

attributes.action: Enshrine the UKRI's long-term mission and Haldane principle in Royal Charter
attributes.background: The Higher Education and Research Bill 2016 will dissolve UK Research Councils' Royal Charters and form a super-council, UK Research & Innovation (UKRI), to act strategically across disciplines. The UKRI must aim to fund research for the UK's long-term good, at arm's length from day-to-day politics.
attributes.additional_details: Higher Education and Research Bill 2016 [Bill No 004 of 2016-17]

attributes.action: Lower prescription charges
attributes.background:
Even being a full time employee, I find £8.20 a lot of money to have to find whilst I also have a family to support.
I understand that something should be paid but I dispute having to pay out all that especially when my health has gone down and have had to have 2 separate prescriptions in 2 weeks.
attributes.additional_details:
The government need to get the charges lowered as before long, prescription payers will rather stay sick then pay out all that money for an NHS prescription.
I also pay my national insurance and would rather pay a little more to have cheaper or free prescriptions as a UK tax payer.
Please join and sign the petition to ask to get the charges lowered or a new method as before long it will be over £10 for 1 item.

attributes.action: Create a standard VED for all vehicles (with a fixed motor/engine) in the UK.
attributes.background: With vehicle excise duty (VED) rising year after year due to emissions, this is unfair and discriminating to large vehicle owners and being detrimental to the haulage industry, especially when hybrid and electric vehicle are exempt from VED. While the road quality in the UK is in decline.
attributes.additional_details: When VED was first introduced 1920 it was original create to help maintain the road structure of the UK up to 1937, due to weight of the vehicle using it. After 1937 it was change to a general tax, then was changed to emissions from 2001. The problem with this is some hybrid/electric vehicle weigh more than fuel vehicles, due to their components (batteries). Creating a greater stress on the road surface then a fuel vehicle. My proposal is to charge £1 for every 10kg the vehicle weighs.

attributes.action: Make killing farm animals in front of each other illegal.
attributes.background: Farm animals are slaughtered in front of other farm animals. It causes great distress to the animal and is inhumane on numerous levels. People are becoming increasingly aware of the treatment of farm animals, hence the rise in veganism, which wouldn't happen if farm animals were treated better.
attributes.additional_details:
There are so many issues with how slaughterhouses are managed, there is no cctv, calves are taken away from their Mothers and killed so that people can consume the cows milk, amongst many other problems. However, this must be tackled one problem at a time in order to cover all areas concerned. 

Putting animals in one room and slaughtering other animals in view of them is barbaric and archaic. There is a rise in documentaries and videos that highlight this issue.

attributes.action: Change/Stop the 'double taxing' of cars bought and sold within the same month.
attributes.background: Car tax is automatically cancelled when a vehicle changes hands, the previous owner can only claim back a full month, so if you sell your car on (example) May 2, you cannot claim a refund on the tax for the rest of the month. The new owner must pay for the full month from May, taxing twice for May.
attributes.additional_details:
External media coverage. 
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/uknews/road-and-rail-transport/11580425/Double-taxing-of-cars-giving-Government-38-million-windfall.html
http://metro.co.uk/2015/05/04/drivers-being-double-taxed-because-of-new-tax-disc-rules-5179870/
http://www.thisismoney.co.uk/money/cars/article-3067185/Scrapping-car-tax-discs-delivers-38m-double-charging-windfall.html

attributes.action: Petition for a referendum on a Republic of Britain with an elected head of state
attributes.background: This is a petition for a referendum on whether to replace the the Crown with a democratically elected head of state and the House of Lords with a democratically elected upper house and introduce a written constitution which politicians must uphold.
attributes.additional_details: The Crown is an hereditary body which is unelected and still holds executive powers over legislation in Britain and cost the public £360 million per annum. This petition is for there to be a referendum to abolish the Crown and replace it with a democratically elected head of state and the House of Lords with a democratically elected upper house. The introduction of the democratically elected bodies would also involve the introduction of w written constitution which politicians must adhere to

attributes.action: Allow EU citizens resident in the UK on 23 June 2016 to cast a retroactive vote.
attributes.background: By denying EU citizens a vote, the Government goes contrary to the UN's declaration of human rights (Article 21): ”The will of the people shall be the basis of the authority of government; this will shall be expressed in periodic and genuine elections which shall be by universal and equal suffrage"
attributes.additional_details: EU citizens deserve a vote, just like citizens of the commonwealth (such as Australia, Canada, New Zealand, Pakistan, India, Bangladesh, Malta, Cyprus etc.) who were resident in the UK were given a vote.

attributes.action: Pay student veterinary nurses whilst on their years placement.
attributes.background: By not paying student veterinary nurses on their year placement this profession is discriminating against less wealthy individuals from pursuing this career. Student finance is not enough to cover the cost of living. It is essentially slave labour to expect any one to work for free for a year.
attributes.additional_details: Every student veterinary nurse at degree level is expected to undertake 2100 hours of full time work placement with out any pay. This expectation is outrageous. Student finance does not cover the cost of living day to day, childcare and the cost of running a car. A diploma level student veterinary nurse gets a wage, however a degree level veterinary nurse doesn't. This is simply slave labour and a way for veterinary practices to have full time staff members at no cost to themselves.

attributes.action: The British blue passport should be reintroduced in 2019
attributes.background: The iconic British blue passport was scrapped in 1988 starting the homogenisation of EU countries with the clear aim of moving towards a United States of Europe and centralisation of power in Brussels. The renewal of contract in 2019 affords an opportunity to reintroduce the classic Blue passport
attributes.additional_details: The traditional British blue passport should be reintroduced in 2019 when the current contract is renewed. The change in colour will be a nil cost option and can be incorporated into the security feature updates.

attributes.action: 50p a month from UK tax payers to get put in a fund for life saving treatment
attributes.background: It should be a requirement of the government to take 50p a month from every tax payer and start a fund for life saving treatment that is not available in the UK. No one should have to try to raise money to save their child's/family members life, it should be readily available as and when it's needed
attributes.additional_details: Charliesfight.org has made me realise no parent should have to try raise money to save their child's life. Giving a working class family one month to raise £1.2million or they switch of their babies machine is heartbreaking. With a readily available fund curtesy of the UK tax payer cases like Charlie's could be funded and sent to America for the life saving treatment needed. 50p a month from every UK tax payer would raise millions of pounds and save lives whilst costing the government nothing.

attributes.action: Allow a Dictionary in the new Modern Foreign Language exams
attributes.background: In the previous MFL exams, students were allowed access to a dictionary. This has now changed and we are no longer allowed any help from a Dictionary at all.
attributes.additional_details: The Exam Board is now expecting us to know every word in the exam. Unless fluent this is going to be impossible. The dictionary was available in the plan before the speaking assessment and for the writing but now it's not allowed at all. Where is the fairness in that? As a year 10 student I am still VERY reliable on the dictionary during lessons and I know I will fail, along with many others, because of this new rule. (Bearing in mind, the exam has stayed as difficult as it was)

attributes.action: Introduce licensing and strict regulation of driven grouse shooting
attributes.background: Grouse shooting is a 'sport' that relies on intensive land management to maximize bird stocking densities and therefore profit. There are many detrimental environmental effects linked to this practice, hence the need for strict legal restrictions and enforced liability of landowners.
attributes.additional_details: To sustain unnaturally high numbers of birds, reckless use of veterinary drugs is commonplace which can have unpredictable impacts on the ecosystem. Rare and protected animals such as hen-harriers are persecuted because they prey on grouse, and mountain hares are culled on mass unnecessarily. Due to frequent heather burning, local flood risk is increased and vital carbon storing peatlands are damaged. Regulation is needed due to the unwillingness of landowners to self-regulate these practices

attributes.action: Reopen the Old Mayfield Train station in Manchester for Virgin Trains.
attributes.background: Reopen the Old Mayfield Train station in Manchester for Virgin Trains and stop wasting money on Hs2. The capacity problems around Manchester could be solved for many train services with this additional station which is in close proximity to Manchester piccadilly train station.
attributes.additional_details: With an ever growing population in the Greater Manchester area and more people using public transport, it seems stupid not to use this station as either a temporary solution or a permanent one. With the electrification project behind schedule towards Preston and Blackpool and more paths needed this will be a massive relief for Manchester piccadilly which is possibly at full capacity.

attributes.action: Basic Life Support (BLS) training as part of the national school curriculum.
attributes.background: Basic Life Support can be a game-changer in terms of increasing survival rates of seriously ill and/or gravely injured individuals, as well as decreasing the chances of irreversible disability. It is quick to master and requires no medical training.
attributes.additional_details:
Basic Life Support focuses on the two main requirement to sustain human life: breathing and blood circulation. Learning Basic Life Support skills requires no medical knowledge and doesn't involve the use of invasive tools or techniques, so quite literally every able-bodied adult or child above the age of circa 12 is capable of learning the life-saving set of skills.

Because the prompt intervention of someone with Basic Life Support training may mean the difference between life and death, and between full recovery and permanent disability, and because it doesn't require a long time or much effort to learn, this skill-set should be taught in every school as part of the national curriculum.

attributes.action: Stop doctors charging people for signing cremation forms
attributes.background: Found out this week that cremation forms need 2 doctors to sign them, which is fine. However both doctors get £82 for the privilege which you may have to pay.
attributes.additional_details: Why should doctors very paid for this and why such a large amount

attributes.action: Amend fixed term parliament act to account for changes of Prime Minister.
attributes.background: 3 times in the past 40 years the Prime Minister has changed without an election. The Fixed Term Parliament Act should include provision that a vote should be held within a year of a change in Prime Minister so that if the House of Commons thinks the government needs a new mandate it can get one.
attributes.additional_details:
http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk_politics/election_2010/8641552.stm In 2010 David Cameron announced that an unelected Prime Minister should have to call a new election within 6 months of taking office. 

Since Theresa May has become PM proposals that weren't in the 2015 Conservative manifesto have been put forward.

The vote to hold a general election requires a two thirds majority to pass. It's not unreasonable within 12 months the Commons should decide if a new mandate is required or not.

attributes.action: Stop allowing employers to ask about criminal convictions before a job offer
attributes.background: Currently employers are allowed to ask an individual about their criminal convictions before a job offer is made. This is unfair and gives employers a "loophole" not to offer a position and say it was not because of criminal declarations but something else. This needs to change.
attributes.additional_details: If the legislation was changed to not allow employers to ask about criminal convictions until an offer of employment has been made it would be very hard for an employer then to say it was not because of an individuals criminal past allowing a more fair and just application process for ex-offenders. The current legislation is poor and despite it being illegal for an employer to not offer employment based solely on someone having a criminal record their are no current protections in place.

attributes.action: Keep a maximum university fee of £9,250 after Brexit.
attributes.background: The prices of university are increasing which will mean there will be a higher debts for students.
attributes.additional_details: Full time tuition fee was up to £9,000 in 2016-2017 but increased to £9,250 in 2017-2018.

attributes.action: Famine ridden South Sudan charging aid workers for entry. UK gov must intervene.
attributes.background: In the face of the biggest famine in 6 years, the South Sudanese government has imposed a $10,000 entrance fee on aid workers entering the country. They are trying to profit from the helplessness of the 7.5 million in need of food. We have a moral obligation to call our government to action.
attributes.additional_details:
The international community, which the UK is a part of, needs to put pressure on South Sudan to allow the completely unrestricted flow of aid to those that need it. Indeed, the UK government needs to formally condemn the immoral and corrupt actions of South Sudanese government, which are nothing short of repulsive.


https://www.google.co.uk/amp/foreignpolicy.com/2017/03/09/famine-wracked-south-sudan-now-wants-to-charge-aid-workers-for-help/amp/

attributes.action: Reduce the business rates increase down to a maximum of 10% pa
attributes.background: many small businesses all over the UK are being forced to close and vacate retail premises due to the government increasing business rates by up to 400% - instantly. This will close shops and increase unemployment. Small businesses simply cannot afford to pay such a large increase.

attributes.action: A supermajority should be required for Scottish independence to be granted.
attributes.background: Independence for Scotland would be such an important constitutional change that it should require the assent of a supermajority in any referendum. A simple majority based on turnout is simply not acceptable. Such a supermajority could be two-thirds of turnout or simple majority of electorate.

attributes.action: Reduce NI Contributions for those on PAYE to the level of the self employed
attributes.background: If the self employed are entitled to the same benefits as those paying NI through PAYE the rates should have parity. Government cannot raise NI for the self employed, lowering the rate for those who pay via PAYE is an option.
attributes.additional_details: The chancellor has been forced to drop an increase in NI contributions for the self employed due to manifesto pledges. The manifesto did not preclude lowering the rate for others.

attributes.action: Scottish Referendum question must include guarantees on borders and currency
attributes.background: In order to avoid confusion and uncertainty any future Scottish Referendum question must gurantee that there will be no hard border between Scotland and England and must also name a valid currency which any future independent Scottish Government would have legal permission to use.

attributes.action: Create a new independent body to regulate football referees in England.
attributes.background:
There is a lack of transparency, consistency, and accountability in how referees are managed in the top flight of English football.  The UK Parliament's recent vote of no confidence in the FA highlights the poor governance.

A new non-FA  independent body is required to rectify the poor standards.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.ft.com/content/718fd0e2-ee15-11e6-ba01-119a44939bb6

attributes.action: The government should reintroduce the dog licence which was abolished in 1987.
attributes.background: Dogs are sometimes treated by owners as controllable children. They are often not. An incredible amount of children and adults are attacked by breeds of dogs which are recognised as being so dangerous that even sizeable humans do not have the skills to tackle them. Even a lap dog can maul a baby.
attributes.additional_details: The Dog Licence was abolished in 1987. It was deemed difficult to enforce with only 50% of owners having a licence. This was pre the internet. A small charge of say £35 per dog or say £70 for a group of dogs paid online would be easy to administer. An online "ownership test" to get the licence might allow for education and enforcement of the act. It would allow the location of dangerous breeds to be known and for animal welfare and conflict with human to be reduced. It would not be onerous.

attributes.action: Give all Public Sector Workers the same pay raises across the board.
attributes.background: All Public Servants, regardless of whether they are a firefighter, NHS, Police, MOD et al they should all receive the same increases. Therefore no one group should be given a raise greater than another group. Therefore the MPs getting 10%, the same should be given to all within the Public Sector.

attributes.action: An election be held on the 4th Thursday after the death or resignation of an MP.
attributes.background: All too often a by election is delayed by the incumbent party to further their own aims.  The Constituents deserve to be represented and no delay should be permitted.

attributes.action: Make all dental treatment free for the over 60's
attributes.background: Dental treatment is too expensive for the over 60's and those on pensions, most other things for the over 60's are either free or reduced, (Prescriptions, Opticians) but not the dentist this needs to change. Liquidising food to feed someone isn't the way forward in the 21st centaury.

attributes.action: Bring in tougher penalties for acts such as 'Car-Dooring'
attributes.background: Motoring laws are a disgrace and the Government needs to change its penalties for offences, families are going without any justice because offences aren't not seen as criminal.
attributes.additional_details: Under current law, if you carelessly open a door and knock a cyclist into the path of a moving vehicle killing them, you can receive an £80 fine. You now get a £200 fine and six points for using your phone whilst driving, so why can you cause death by being careless and practically get away with it?

attributes.action: Abolish the drivers insurance instead have a insurance based on the car they own
attributes.background: Most of the countries around the world including Europe calculate insurance based on the car you own. Why in England we need to pay insurance based on the driver? Once car is insured any driver with the legal driving license can drive that car! Isn't is so easy? Please support this petition. Thanks

attributes.action: Make having a creche for in the workplace and uni mandatory and free for kids.
attributes.background: I am a single mother on benefits and I desperately want to work. Im 22 with no qualifications. I have a high school diploma and I have been well educated in private schools I have a lot to offer if I was given a chance. But you utter single mother and people look at you strange when I do everything.
attributes.additional_details: My child is 1 I want to be able to see her all the time while working. I do not want to live off the state I want to get into the music industry and also get a doctorate in psychology. I dont want to miss out on my daughters youth. There should be a creche at unis and places of work. I want to be independent.

attributes.action: Increase the funding into grassroots football in the UK.
attributes.background: I believe the state of amateur football picthes across the UK is appalling. The amount of injuries sustained to young and old footballers is increasing on these sort of playing fields. In my opinion, by improving pitches it will not only benefit football in general but the entire nation as a whole.
attributes.additional_details: I have sustained injuries on the current playing fields near my house playing for my local side. Furthermore, I know many others who have had similar experiences to myself. I believe that if we had better grass to play on, it would motivate more of the public to get involved in the sport as well as just getting healthier as a nation. By improving grassroots football, we are becoming healthier and more motivated. Football is just the beginning ,we could also improve rugby pitches and many more.

attributes.action: Simplify marriage law and remove references to sex or gender
attributes.background:
Marriage in the UK is governed by multiple acts of parliament with specific laws for civil partnership and same sex marriage.  However, the legislation still sees same sex and opposite sex couples differently.

The law should be consolidated and simplified to correct this.
attributes.additional_details:
The law on marriage should be rewritten with all references to sex, gender and/or sexual orientation removed.  Terms for unions should be standardised and include a distinction between religious and civil unions.

When changing legal gender a person should not be required to dissolve or convert an existing union.

Religious organisations should be still allowed to refuse to perform weddings which would contradict their faith but this right should not be limited to same sex marriages.

attributes.action: The UK Prime Minister and Parliament must publicly condemn Trump's BBC ban
attributes.background: On 24th February, UK public service broadcaster BBC and several other media outlets were barred from attending an audience with US White House Press Speaker. This happened only hours after President Donald Trump had tweeted that "fake news media" were "the enemy of the American people".
attributes.additional_details: This unprecedented decision is not only an affront to freedom of expression in general, but also an insult to the professional integrity and ethics of the UK public service broadcasting system. The UK PM has invited Trump to pay a state visit in our country, which will be also covered in the news by the very same public organisation that he has now publicly distrusted. The UK PM and Parliament must unequivocally condemn President Trump's BBC ban as well as all his attacks to the media.

attributes.action: Require autonomous vehicles to display a visible warning beacon when in motion.
attributes.background: As a software engineer with many years' experience, I  think that mixing AVs with conventional traffic on public roads is  highly risky, with potentially serious/fatal consequences for road users. It will require many years of development to perfect the tech in all weathers/conditions.
attributes.additional_details: There have already been several incidents reported in the USA.

attributes.action: NHS to be run by each local council rather than a national organisation
attributes.background: The NHS is run as a national organisation which means that money is wasted rather than being spent on the actual needs of hospitals. This would look to change that and instead give the responsibilities of running the local NHS to local councils - looking at the hospital needs, therefore less waste.

attributes.action: Stop the use of snail slime in beauty products.
attributes.background: The producers/companies agitate and scare the snails using shock/salt to get the desired level of secretion. This is harming and torturing the snails for the use of snail slime in beauty products. It is inhumane, and no animal should be treated this way.

attributes.action: Prevent employers making employees pay for company uniforms.
attributes.background: It is unfair that employees should have to pay for uniforms which are mainly intended to provide corporate identity, especially those which display company logos.  Deductions from wages for staff uniforms may render earnings below the minimum wage as a result.

attributes.action: Provide income tax relief and remove insurance premium tax on health insurance.
attributes.background: The affordability and rapid uptake in the number of individuals and employing organisations taking out private health insurance across the uk would immediately ease the current pressure on the NHS. There would also be a rapid growth of private sector health care in the uk providing economic benefit.
attributes.additional_details: There is currently no financial incentive for individuals or organisations to take out private health care insurance.The NHS is left to pick up all the workloads and costs of large numbers of the uk population who would by choice move into private sector health care provision if the cost of premiums were lowered by incentives. This would rapidly reduce the demand on NHS services across the uk now and for the foreseeable future and stimulate growth and investment in private health care provision.

attributes.action: The time has come for a Compulsory test for cyclists.
attributes.background: with the increase of  cycling in the UK in recent years deaths of cyclists on British roads are increasing . There is already a test but its not compulsory , the National Standards for Cycle training test known as Bike -ability.
attributes.additional_details: the death rate on Britain's roads is reducing thankfully, but the exception is with cyclist's.  I have never understood the logic of untrained people using busy roads and risking their lives daily. If a cyclist is a driver then they will have taken the driving test and know the rules of the road, but many are non drivers and are a danger to themselves and others.

attributes.action: Make it an offence to impersonate any of our emergency services.
attributes.background:
At present, in the U.K it is only an offence to impersonate a Police Officer and not any of our other emergency services.
With this loop hole, we have members of the public masquerading as Paramedics, Fire Officers and more. This leaves Police officers powerless to act.
attributes.additional_details:
I have produced a short documentary to prove my point, which you can view here.

https://youtu.be/E4k1NOhABWQ

attributes.action: GCSE students should study their chosen subject from year 8.
attributes.background: I believe studying a GCSE is incredibly hard from personal experience, I have found that learning and subject for less that 2 years at GCSE isn't very usefully as it's hard to lear alll the content I believe that from year 8 we should start doing GCSE work because it would alllow for more practice.
attributes.additional_details: Furthermore, students would be benefited from this because their work would actually be at use by the time exams come around. Learning for year 8 would allow year 7 to be a year where you deciede what subjects you want to take at GCSE and with 4 years of learning this would allow students to possibly take on more GCSEs due to the increased learning time.

attributes.action: The establishment of UK legislation protecting Net Neutrality
attributes.background: The free and open internet as it is today has fostered innovation, provided access to information, and facilitated many cultural, economic and political opportunities across this world. It is a driver and tool of innovation, globally and here in the UK. And should be protected so it is not lost.
attributes.additional_details: With the Great Repeal Bill coming forward, we have concerns over the potential loss of protection to Net Neutrality. While the Broadcasters Stakeholders Group has a Code of Practise, this is a voluntary measure and if the UK was to open up contracts to global companies for future trade deals, this measure may not be enough to safeguard Net Neutrality here in Britain. We want the government to take early action and also establish the UK as a global leader in safeguarding a free and open internet.

attributes.action: Enable Young Couples to Rent by Regulating HMO Licenses
attributes.background:
Young professionals are being forced out of Cities such as Oxford and Cambridge to move back in with their parents due to lack of housing caused by HMO regulations.
We need to have the regulations changed so councils cannot go as low as 2 households / 3 people to require an HMO license.
attributes.additional_details:
Many councils have implemented regulations that prevent more than THREE people residing in a dwelling. Even if TWO of those are a renting couple.

While HMOs may have increased the number of rooms to rent, it is equally removing the amount of available properties for young professionals. Our government should be aware and improve these HMO regulations to ensure more availability.
I strongly believe this will help stabilise housing and help hundreds of individuals who are a value to our cities.

attributes.action: Grant automatic asylum to any unaccompanied, displaced child seeking help
attributes.background:
Our MP's recently voted by a majority, to reject a plan for Britain to give shelter and asylum to Syrian children who had arrived in Europe unaccompanied. 
It should be compulsory for our government to grant asylum to vulnerable unaccompanied children, wether orphaned or seperated from family.

attributes.action: Save our NHS/Social care
attributes.background: The goverment has proved incapable of saving the NHS/social care and making the necessary decisons necessary to do this.  We the public demand taxation is increased and all money raised goes to NHS/Social services only & foreign aid used when people from overseas using our NHS are unable to pay
attributes.additional_details: In order to save NHS/Social care services taxation must be increased with certain conditions applied which must include firstly any extra money raised must ONLY go to the NHS/Social care services, secondly NHS and Social care services must be more integrated, thirdly less financial support for conditions with relate to lifestyle choices such as obesity, alcoholism and drug abuse and finally payment for those using our NHS/Social care from abroad unable to pay taken from foreign aid

attributes.action: op out of paying into the overseas aid budget and put this to tax to  the NHS
attributes.background: I don't want to put my tax to country's that can afford to send rockets into space when in the uk we have  old people on trolleys in hospital's we need to put the overseas budget to the NHS . if you want to pay into the overseas aid you can op in through the tax system
attributes.additional_details: read the press

attributes.action: PARKING TICKETS: Put clear signage & road markings in restricted parking areas.
attributes.background: Council's should display more signs & have road markings identifying restricted/permit parking areas. Currently, they only have to have a sign on the entrance of the road. These signs can be easily missed, then consequently people are being fined up to £70. This is unfair and needs to be changed.
attributes.additional_details: The requirements for Local Authorities to erect 'Permit Holders Only' repeater signs has been removed which anables the local councils to make more money on these permit holders only areas by not informing the public that the area they are parked in is permit only areas. This is purely a money making scheme and nothing else.
